project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern for state management. The app displays a text with an icon, and upon clicking the text, it toggles between 'Cat' with a clock icon and 'Dog' with a person icon.
architecture_overview: This project follows a modular architecture with a separation of concerns. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, organizing the code into widgets, cubits, and models.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant Main
participant HomeScreen
participant AnimalCubit
participant AnimalText
User -> Main: start app
Main -> HomeScreen: create
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: provide
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: create
User -> AnimalText: click
AnimalText -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal
AnimalCubit -> Animal: update state
Animal -> AnimalCubit: state updated
AnimalCubit -> HomeScreen: notify
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: rebuild
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using a Cubit named AnimalCubit. When the user clicks on the text, the AnimalCubit toggles the state between 'Cat' and 'Dog'. The AnimalText widget listens for state changes and updates accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which is the initial and only screen in the navigation stack.
